text: to avoid any problems that's where the
cross-training and strength training is
important Annie is always to do with the
tracking of the knee usually a tight ITB
and weak inside muscles the knee
stabilizing muscle so you basically just
want to strengthen your stabilizing
muscles on the inside of the knee keep
the outside the ITB nice and loose also
it comes a lot from the hip so
stretching well through the hips
piriformis but hamstring that all helps
with keeping the knee and the knee joint
in place so I'm big on Stairmaster
elliptical and the actually swimming as
well which really stretches your through
your stomach and keeps your spine nice
and straight and builds your lower abs
cycling's good spinning classes okay but
quite often if you've been sitting in an
office all day 1012 hours a day and
you're getting back on the bike and
sitting again it's just going to make
you a lot tighter through the hips I
mean you're running you've got to
basically get everything forward you've
got to get this up your hips forward to
chest out and so it's quite often
tightness comes from your lower back
goes through your piriformis and down
down your ITB get your knee pulls the
tracking out and that's how you end up
with knee problems so I would probably
maybe have one day off in the program
and I would run three to four days a
week and the other days would be
cross-training and strength training
